title: TRAINING OF FUTURE ENERGY SPECIALISTS TO SOLVE PRACTICAL PROBLEMS ON THE BASIS OF PHYSICAL PROJECTS
summary: This paper explores the effectiveness of using physical projects in training future energy specialists to solve practical problems. The authors analyze research in education, the National Qualifications Framework, and standard higher education requirements to develop an effective teaching method.
methodology: The study used a pedagogical experiment to test the effectiveness of physical projects in training future energy specialists. Statistical calculations were performed to track the dynamics of ability formation and establish scientific reliability.
statistics: quantitative and qualitative data processing, graphical presentation of results
research_outcomes: The analysis showed significant qualitative changes in the levels of formation of the ability of future energy specialists to solve practical problems by EG physics. The using of physical projects is an effective teaching method in the training of future energy specialists.

title: Using social media advertisement data to monitor the gender gap in STEM: opportunities and challenges
summary: This paper investigates the feasibility of using Facebook and Instagram advertising audience estimates for modeling the leaky pipeline phenomenon in the USA. The authors filter the advertising audience estimates by location, age, gender, and interests related to STEM, compute the gender gap index, and compare it across age groups at the US metro level. However, they conclude that there is little evidence that this novel data source can measure the decline in interest in STEM for young women in the USA.
methodology: The authors use Facebook and Instagram advertising audience estimates to model the leaky pipeline phenomenon in the USA. They filter the data by location, age, gender, and interests related to STEM, compute the gender gap index, and compare it across age groups at the US metro level.
research_outcomes: The authors found that there is little evidence that social media advertisement data can measure the decline in interest in STEM for young women in the USA. They also found that usage intensity differences, rather than inherent interest changes, might create the illusion of a leaky pipeline.

title: Improvement of English Teaching Model Based on Computer Network
summary: This paper explores the improvement of English teaching mode based on computer image assistance, using computer-assisted instruction to enhance students' motivation and participation in classroom activities. The study integrates machine learning concepts into traditional teaching methods, promoting a student-centered approach and utilizing modern information technology for autonomous learning.
methodology: The paper employs a pretest and posttest experimental research design, using SPSS software to analyze students' scores and compare the changes before and after the test. The study also incorporates computer image-assisted teaching technology to present content in a multimodal way, allowing students to learn effectively through various senses.
research_outcomes: The results show that computer image-assisted teaching can maximize the use of classrooms to improve students' opportunities to use language and fully reflect students' role as the main body of practice in English learning.

title: Comparison of Learning Transfer Using Simulation Problem-Based Learning and Demonstration: An Application of Papanicolaou Smear Nursing Education
summary: This study compares the effects of simulation problem-based learning (S-PBL) and demonstration-based learning on nursing students' self-confidence, learner satisfaction, and critical thinking in Pap smear education. The results show that S-PBL is an effective strategy for improving learning transfer, but ML/AI methods are not used in this paper.
methodology: Quasi-experimental control group pretest-posttest design
research_outcomes: S-PBL was found to be an effective strategy for improving learning transfer, applying learned nursing knowledge to simulated nursing situations. Self-confidence, learner satisfaction, and critical thinking increase significantly more in the experimental group compared to the control group.

title: Scalable quantum computational chemistry with superconducting qubits
summary: This paper presents a scalable solution to the molecular electronic structure problem in quantum chemistry using variational quantum eigensolver (VQE) with superconducting qubits. The authors demonstrate high-accuracy results for H2, LiH, and F2 molecules by integrating error mitigation schemes and optimising the algorithm.
methodology: Variational quantum eigensolver (VQE) with superconducting qubits
statistics: Classical optimisation and stochastic gradient descent
research_outcomes: High-accuracy results for H2, LiH, and F2 molecules; scalable solution to molecular electronic structure problem

title: Assessing prior knowledge types as predictors of academic achievement in the introductory phase of biology and physics study programmes using logistic regression
summary: This paper explores the relationship between prior knowledge types and academic achievement in biology and physics introductory courses. The authors use logistic regression to evaluate the predictive power of four prior knowledge types on student achievement, finding that only certain types of prior knowledge are significant predictors for each subject.
methodology: The study uses a combination of logistic regression models to evaluate the relationship between prior knowledge types and academic achievement. The authors control for high school grade point average (HS GPA) as an established predictor of academic achievement, then add the four prior knowledge types as predictors.
research_outcomes: The study finds that only certain types of prior knowledge are significant predictors for each subject. For biology, knowledge about principles and concepts is a significant predictor in the first year. For physics, knowledge about concepts and principles as well as the ability to apply knowledge to problems is related to academic achievement.

title: Exploring Kid Space in the wild: a preliminary study of multimodal and immersive collaborative play-based learning experiences
summary: This paper presents a preliminary study on Kid Space, an immersive computing experience designed to engage children in physical movement and social collaboration during play-based learning. The technology incorporates multimodal sensing and sensemaking technologies, including face, pose, and gesture recognition, location tracking, ambient audio classification, automatic speech recognition, and natural language understanding and dialogue management.
methodology: The study used a formative research method with eight first-grade students, collecting multimodal data (audio and video) along with observational, interview, and questionnaire data. The results show that the students demonstrated high levels of engagement, less attention focused on the screen, and more physical activity.
research_outcomes: The study enabled actionable insights to improve Kid Space for future deployments, including the need for real-time personalization.

title: Research on Integrating Ideological and Political Elements into Vocational College Public English on the Basis of Project Teaching Method
summary: This paper explores the practice and research of integrating ideological and political elements into vocational college public English teaching using project-based teaching. The study aims to provide a meaningful reference for ideological and political teaching of English courses in the future, with a focus on cultivating students' patriotism and international vision.
methodology: Project-based teaching is a student-centered and inquiry-based teaching mode that emphasizes taking students as the center and changing the traditional teaching mode. The method encourages students to use online resources and various learning strategies to learn in real situations.
research_outcomes: The study found that project-based teaching can effectively integrate ideological and political elements into vocational college public English teaching, promoting students' language skills, practical abilities, and comprehensive capability. The research also highlights the importance of teachers' guidance and the role of project tasks in stimulating students' learning motivation.

title: Crossword puzzle as a learning tool to enhance learning about anticoagulant therapeutics
summary: This study evaluates the effectiveness of crossword puzzles as an active learning tool in pharmacy education, specifically for teaching anticoagulant therapeutics. The research found that students generally have positive perceptions of the activity and that it can enhance information recall and retention.
methodology: The study used a cross-sectional design, where crossword puzzles were implemented as an active learning tool in therapeutic courses for pharmacy students. Students' perceptions were evaluated through surveys and questionnaires.
research_outcomes: Students generally had positive perceptions of the activity, with most expressing favorable views on its effectiveness in enhancing their learning. The study found no significant association between students' learning styles and their perception of the crossword puzzle activity.

title: Exploring the Impact of the Counseling Service on Student-Teachers' Academic Performance: The Case of E.P. College of Education, Bimbilla
summary: This study explores the impact of counseling services on student-teachers' academic performance in E.P. College of Education, Bimbilla. The research found that counseling service equips student-teachers with good study and time management skills to improve their academic performance.
methodology: The study employed a qualitative approach with case study in focus, using stratified sampling technique to select 250 student-teachers, 4 tutor-counselors, and a vice principal. Data was analyzed using SPSS version 17 and descriptive statistics such as frequency distributions and percentages.
research_outcomes: The study concluded that counseling service could help student-teachers build positive self-image which could lead to better academic performance.

title: Evaluation Method of Public Physical Training Quality Based on Global Topology Optimization Deep Learning Model
summary: This paper proposes a new public sports training quality evaluation method based on the global topology optimization deep learning model. The method improves the accuracy of evaluation results and has certain feasibility, making it a substantial contribution to the field of education.
methodology: The proposed method uses a deep learning model to evaluate public sports training quality by determining basic criteria, extracting quality data, constructing indicators, normalizing them, and realizing quality evaluation.
research_outcomes: The results show that the proposed method can effectively improve the accuracy of evaluation results and has certain feasibility.
sources_of_inspiration: Reference [7] proposed a method of physical education quality evaluation based on integration.
Reference [8] proposed an evaluation method of public sports service supply level from the perspective of basic public service equalization.
Reference [9] proposed an IPA-BASED public sports service quality evaluation model research.
Reference [10] proposed a public sports service quality evaluation method for large stadiums based on public perception.

title: Research on Inclusive Education for Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) Children in Southern Jiangxi
summary: This paper examines the current status and challenges of inclusive education for ASD children in Southern Jiangxi, China. It discusses the development of inclusive education in both China and foreign countries, highlighting the importance of creating opportunities for ASD children to interact with normal children and improve their social communication skills.
methodology: The paper uses a qualitative approach, analyzing existing research on inclusive education for ASD children in Southern Jiangxi and other regions. It also discusses the development status of inclusive education for such children both in China and foreign countries.
research_outcomes: The study highlights the challenges faced by ASD children in receiving inclusive education in Southern Jiangxi, including high costs, insufficient resources, and uneven distribution of campus capital. It also discusses the importance of creating a suitable education environment for students with special needs.

title: That Wasn't the Math I Wanted to do!
summary: This paper examines students' beliefs about mathematics during the transition from school to university, focusing on the role of static and dynamic beliefs in predicting success. The study uses questionnaires to assess students' beliefs at the beginning and middle of their first term at university, finding that dynamic beliefs decrease while static beliefs remain stable.
methodology: Quantitative study using questionnaires
research_outcomes: Dynamic beliefs negatively predict dropout intention, while static beliefs are a negative predictor of achievement in real analysis. Beliefs assessed in the middle of the term have stronger predictive power than those at the beginning.

title: Secondary Education and COVID-19
summary: This paper explores the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on secondary education, discussing changes in teaching methods, including distance learning and hybrid models. The use of digital technology became a primary modality for ensuring educational continuity during school closures.
methodology: The authors employed a qualitative research approach to examine the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic on secondary education.
research_outcomes: The study found that distance learning and hybrid models were effective in maintaining educational continuity during school closures. However, challenges such as reduced in-class instruction time and validation of skills and knowledge produced through hybrid learning need to be addressed.

title: The proofing validation of conventional mechanical drawing job sheet
summary: This paper focuses on developing and assessing the feasibility of a Job Drawing course in Mechanical Drawing (MD) at Yogyakarta State University. The research uses the 4-D Thiagarajan model, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
methodology: The study used a research and development approach with the Four-D model development step (define, design, develop, and disseminate).
research_outcomes: The development of the job sheet was successfully carried out by the MD Semester Learning Plan (SLP) in DMEE, consisting of 43 drawing tasks divided into 13 sections. The results showed that the product developed was very feasible.

title: A Case Study of Drama Education for Indigenous Children in The Alternative Classroom
summary: This paper investigates the use of drama education as an alternative approach to teaching indigenous children. It explores how drama can be used to improve social development and engagement in learning, particularly for children who may struggle with traditional educational methods.
methodology: Qualitative study using observation and interviews
research_outcomes: Positive outcomes of drama education, including improved non-verbal communication and social skills. The study suggests that drama can be an effective approach for indigenous children who may struggle with traditional educational methods.

title: The impact of learning strategies on the academic achievement of university students in Saudi Arabia
summary: This study investigates the learning strategies adopted by Saudi university students and their impact on academic achievement. The research found that microstrategies and study habits are the most preferred strategies, with female students using them more than male students. The study also found a significant predictor of student academic achievement.
methodology: Cross-sectional descriptive analytic approach
research_outcomes: The study revealed that microstrategies and study habits are the most preferred strategies by Saudi university students, with female students using them more than male students. The study also found a significant predictor of student academic achievement.

title: Initial learning scenarios based on the computational thinking evaluation for the course Programming fundamentals at INACAP
summary: This paper presents a design and planning of initial learning scenarios for the course Programming Fundamentals, focusing on computational thinking evaluation. The research aims to favor motivation and autonomy in study through recognition of skills and instructional design. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this paper.
methodology: The methodology involves establishing a relationship between the course content, knowledge, and skills with computational thinking evaluation. The research uses a face-to-face course with five learning units and online work hours.
research_outcomes: The paper proposes initial learning scenarios that represent a first academic teacher's guide to favor motivation and autonomy in study, reducing school dropout through preventive actions.

title: EFL Teaching in KSA
summary: This study examines the current strategies of teaching English as a foreign language in Saudi Arabian universities, highlighting the need for improved methods and increased student motivation. The research focuses on the importance of English in achieving the Kingdom's Vision 2030, which emphasizes empowering individuals through education.
methodology: The study used a questionnaire given to first-year students at the Northern Border University, analyzing data with SPSS software.
research_outcomes: The study found that students are motivated when learning by technology and need to use English in everyday life communications. Teachers should receive professional development in pedagogies and be periodically tested and evaluated based on standardized international tests.

title: Manifestation Of Prophetic Leadership Values In Islamic Education
summary: This paper explores the manifestation of prophetic leadership values in Islamic education, highlighting the importance of moral values and humanism in educational institutions. The study uses a library research approach with data analysis methods, content analysis, and spiral analysis to examine the concept of prophetic leadership and its application in education.
methodology: Library research approach with qualitative analysis
research_outcomes: The study finds that prophetic leadership values are essential for Islamic educational institutions, emphasizing the need to prioritize moral values and humanism over materialistic and capitalist interests.

title: Design and Research of Mathematics Teaching Intelligent Classroom Based on PCA-NN Algorithm
summary: This paper proposes an optimization model of mathematics classroom design and teaching quality evaluation based on the PCA-NN algorithm. The research focuses on improving the quality of mathematics classroom teaching by effectively integrating ML/AI methods into the design and evaluation process.
methodology: The PCA-NN algorithm is used to analyze the correlation degree between different types of data, reducing dimensionality for efficient data processing and improving computational efficiency.
research_outcomes: The results show that the mathematics teaching intelligent classroom based on the PCA-NN algorithm can effectively improve the quality of mathematics classroom teaching. The evaluation model provides a comprehensive purpose index for the construction of classroom teaching quality.
sources_of_inspiration: Selvi and Muthulakshmi (intelligent teaching method for teenagers)
Ayachi et al. (intelligent classroom model based on multistrategy technology)

title: Application of Mind Map in Teaching Geometry in Grade 4
summary: This paper explores the effectiveness of using mind maps in teaching geometry to fourth-grade students. The study demonstrates that incorporating mind maps into the curriculum can improve student learning motivation and subject interests, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
methodology: The study employed an experiment with 44 primary students to evaluate the feasibility and effectiveness of using mind maps in teaching geometry. The findings were based on a survey and analysis of student performance.
research_outcomes: The results showed that most students can create an appropriate mind map to review a lesson, and that the mind map contributes to increasing students' learning motivation and subject interests.

title: Students’ Acceptance of Technology-Mediated Teaching – How It Was Influenced During the COVID-19 Pandemic in 2020: A Study From Germany
summary: This paper investigates students' acceptance of technology-mediated teaching during the COVID-19 pandemic. The authors applied the Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) to examine the acceptance of technology-mediated teaching by students in two disciplines: information systems and music and arts. The study found that students' acceptance of technology-mediated teaching differed depending on the discipline, with students in information systems showing higher acceptance rates than those in music and arts.
methodology: The authors used a longitudinal study design to collect data from 875 responses gathered from students of two disciplines at four points in time. The Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) was applied to examine the acceptance of technology-mediated teaching by students.
research_outcomes: The study found that students' acceptance of technology-mediated teaching differed depending on the discipline, with students in information systems showing higher acceptance rates than those in music and arts. The authors also found that the Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) was effective in predicting students' acceptance of technology-mediated teaching.

title: Trends in Educational Gamification: Challenges and Learning Opportunities
summary: This special issue explores the application of gamification in education, highlighting its potential to engage learners and promote creativity. However, it also notes challenges and limitations, including a lack of understanding among teachers about how to effectively implement gamification.
methodology: The papers presented in this special issue employ various methodologies, including bibliometric surveys, game design approaches, and live-action games. The authors use these methods to explore the state-of-the-art in educational gamification and identify areas for future research.
research_outcomes: The special issue presents a range of research outcomes, including insights into the effectiveness of gamification in promoting learning, challenges faced by teachers in implementing gamification, and potential applications of game design in education.

title: Dropout at Danish vocational schools: does the school’s health promotion capacity play a role?
summary: This study investigates the association between VET schools' health promotion capacity and student dropout rates. The authors found no associations between health promotion capacity and dropout rates, suggesting that other factors may play a more significant role in determining student completion of education.
methodology: Prospective study combining survey- and register-based data to investigate the association between VET schools' health promotion capacity and student dropout rates.
research_outcomes: No associations were observed between VET schools' health promotion capacity and student dropout rates. Other school characteristics, such as geographical location, school type, and students' age and ethnicity, may explain dropout rates.
